Schiehallion

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Schiehallion is one of the most familiar and best known mountains in Scotland. A whaleback ridge from most viewpoints, it appears as a perfect cone when seen from across Loch Rannoch. Contour lines were invented on the mountain as part of an experiment to determine the mass of the earth.

 You have not climbed Schiehallion.

Region: Perthshire

Altitude: 1083 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 3.58/5
Rating: 3.6/5 (267 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Schiehallion from the Braes of Foss

Other routes and challenges

Ascent by the route given above is strongly encouraged. The only sensible alternative is an approach from near East Tempar Farm, heading up a track by the Tempar Burn before striking off to ascend the west ridge.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Perthshire Hotels

Perthshire B&B

Perthshire Cottages

Perthshire Hostels

Panoramic summit view (click to open)

There are 14897 Walkhighlanders who have climbed Schiehallion. They have contributed 184 public walk reports including this summit. These are ordered below with the most popular ones first. The rightmost column shows how many summits were included in their report, which may help you to find the most relevant reports.
